core_concept: Quantum entanglement is a special connection between two or more particles that lets them affect each other even when they're really far apart. Imagine you have two toy cars, and you connect them with a magic spring. If you push one car, the other car will move too, even if it's on the other side of the room! This is kind of like what happens with entangled particles.

key_actors_and_components.name: Entangled Particles
key_actors_and_components.description: Tiny bits of matter that are connected in a special way.

key_actors_and_components.name: Quantum State
key_actors_and_components.description: The properties of an object, like its spin or energy level.

key_actors_and_components.name: Measurement Error
key_actors_and_components.description: A small mistake in how we measure something.

story_of_process.name: The Connection
story_of_process.description: Two particles are created together, and they become entangled. This means their quantum states are connected in a special way.

story_of_process.name: The Separation
story_of_process.description: The two particles are separated, but they're still connected by the magic spring of entanglement.

story_of_process.name: The Change
story_of_process.description: Something happens to one particle, like it gets a tiny bit of energy or changes its spin. This instantly affects the other particle, even if they're really far apart!

story_of_process.name: The Measurement
story_of_process.description: We try to measure the properties of the particles, but because of measurement error, we might not get exactly what's going on.

core_principles.name: Wave-Particle Duality
core_principles.description: Some things can be both waves and particles, depending on how we observe them. Entanglement is a way that this duality works at the quantum level.

core_principles.name: Non-Locality
core_principles.description: Entangled particles are connected in such a way that what happens to one affects the other, even if they're really far apart.

core_principles.name: Superposition
core_principles.description: Quantum objects can exist in many states at once, which is important for understanding entanglement.
